messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] This list, again
messages.msgSnippet: ... But, who on Earth would even WANT to!?  (that s a rhetorical question, folks!) (BG) Marji
messages.messageBody:
At 21:10 8/9/03 -0400, Kelly wrote:
>Now you can't shut me up----

But, who on Earth would even WANT to!? (that's a rhetorical question,
folks!) (BG)

Marji

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-Discussion] This list, again
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/9/2003 8:59:26 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Me, too. I really, really read and read. I read til my eyes watered---came back and read
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/9/2003 8:59:26 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
fetteroll@... writes:


> When I first visited AOL's homeschooling forum it was very intimidating.
> All
> these people who knew so much and could spot the least little bit of off
> thinking and weren't afraid to point it out.
>
> So I read and read and read. When I was done with the message boards I read
> the archives, going back 3 or 4 years.
>
> After that it was like I'd actually been on the list for 3 or 4 years. I
> knew the people, I knew the topic. Which made it very easy to post.

Me, too. I really, really read and read. I read 'til my eyes watered---came
back and read some more. I don't think I missed one archive---just read and
read and read. When he light went off in my head, it was GLORIOUS! And THEN I
started posting, as if I were a "regular"---but by then I *felt* like it!

Now you can't shut me up----well, Joyce or Helen *could*. <G>

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
